title: SDK-style solution file
body:
We all know solution (.sln) files are not ideal:
- Hard to read
- Hard to version control
- Are overly verbose
- Use a non-standard format

An SDK-style solution file would provide the following benefits:
- Easier to read, and would consistent with other metadata .NET files e.g. csproj, Directory.build.props etc
- Easier to version control, as XML is
- Removing heavy use of Guids would reduce it's size
- Would be more approachable for new-comers.

There have been community attempts at this, most notably https://github.com/JeffCyr/MSBuild.SolutionSdk.

There has also been much talk about this on Tech Twitter in recent years:
- https://twitter.com/Nick_Craver/status/1176924151250071553

.NET 7 seems like a great time for this!
